thread.title: Ironic Mother Earth - In Jerusalem -
thread.title_full: Ironic Mother Earth - In Jerusalem - Jerusalem Post

author: ARI MARRACHE \
title: Ironic Mother Earth - In Jerusalem -
text:
The only natural aspect of the Jerusalem Natural History Museum gallery’s “Ironic Nature” exhibit, which brings life to 25 types of animals and insects, is a single branch from an ailanthus tree. The Hebrew title of Jerusalem-based artist Navah De Shalit’s installation “Teva Ironi” is a play on the Hebrew homonym ironi, enabling the title to connote “City Nature” as well as “Ironic Nature.”
Read More...
